title: How to Make Zero Carb Ice Cream

steps.headline: Warm the almond milk a bit by microwaving it for about a minute.
Combine 2 1/2 cups of warm almond milk, oil, xanthan gum, and guar gum in a blender.
steps.description: Puree/mix on a high setting for about a minute. After a minute, the mixture should be thicker and there should be no oil separating and floating to the top. If there is oil still separate from the mixture, add a pinch more xanthan gum and remix in blender. If the mixture turned out too thick, like gelatin, then too much xanthan gum was added.

steps.headline: Add salt, vanilla extract, other cup of almond milk, and mix in blender for another 30-60 seconds.
steps.description: Add unsweetened cocoa powder at this point if desired and blend until the powder is combined and the mixture is smooth.

steps.headline: Add sweetener to taste (otherwise a sweetness equivalent to 1/2 - 2/3 cup of sugar).
steps.description: Liquid sweeteners can just be added to the blender mixture and mixed. Granulated sweeteners will need to be dissolved, so the blender mixture will need to be poured in a saucepan on medium heat. Add granulated sweetener of choice and stir in saucepan until sweetener is completely dissolved.

steps.headline: Churn ice cream according to manufacturer's instructions in an ice cream maker
steps.description: After roughly 15 - 20 minutes in the machine, the ice cream should look thicker, and then your choice of ingredients can be added (such as chopped nuts, frozen bits of fruit, chocolate chips, etc). This will raise the carbohydrate count of the ice cream, so be careful.

steps.headline: Continue churning until the ice cream is the consistency of soft-serve ice cream.
steps.description: Turn off the machine and scoop the soft serve into a sealable container. Place it in the freezer or dig in if you're more of a fan of soft serve. The ice cream should harden a bit after staying in the freezer.

text: Warm the almond milk a bit by microwaving it for about a minute.  Combine 2 1/2 cups of warm almond milk, oil, xanthan gum, and guar gum in a blender. Puree/mix on a high setting for about a minute. After a minute, the mixture should be thicker and there should be no oil separating and floating to the top. If there is oil still separate from the mixture, add a pinch more xanthan gum and remix in blender. If the mixture turned out too thick, like gelatin, then too much xanthan gum was added. Add salt, vanilla extract, other cup of almond milk, and mix in blender for another 30-60 seconds. Add unsweetened cocoa powder at this point if desired and blend until the powder is combined and the mixture is smooth. Add sweetener to taste (otherwise a sweetness equivalent to 1/2 - 2/3 cup of sugar). Liquid sweeteners can just be added to the blender mixture and mixed. Granulated sweeteners will need to be dissolved, so the blender mixture will need to be poured in a saucepan on medium heat. Add granulated sweetener of choice and stir in saucepan until sweetener is completely dissolved. Chill mixture in refrigerator.  Churn ice cream according to manufacturer's instructions in an ice cream maker After roughly 15 - 20 minutes in the machine, the ice cream should look thicker, and then your choice of ingredients can be added (such as chopped nuts, frozen bits of fruit, chocolate chips, etc). This will raise the carbohydrate count of the ice cream, so be careful. Continue churning until the ice cream is the consistency of soft-serve ice cream. Turn off the machine and scoop the soft serve into a sealable container. Place it in the freezer or dig in if you're more of a fan of soft serve. The ice cream should harden a bit after staying in the freezer. Finished.
